website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic option for buyers seeking a multi-function product with a convenient aerial handle.
pros: Blade crafted from durable stainless steel
Feet suction to counter, keeping product in place
Can grate, slice, and shred cheese and vegetables
cons: Plastic bits may come off of product during first few uses

customer_reviews.title: I do like the fold up legs feature and really like the ...
customer_reviews.text: My mother had one of these, and then I got it, used it for years. Eventually it rusted some, so I thought that is it. Then I found this on Amazon and ordered it, it arrived as scheduled. This new one is larger than the original and is made of plastic where the original was metal. The original had four disks and this has three. I do like the fold up legs feature and really like the rubber feet, they keep the machine from dancing all over the counter top. It is large enough to put a pretty good size bowl underneath to catch the shavings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite kitchen item!
customer_reviews.text: We eat a lot of cheese in our family. This makes grating cheese so much easier and is very easy to throw in the dishwasher. It takes a chore that nobody likes and turns it into a super easy one which is done in a quarter of the time. Doesn't take up much space either. I've also had mine for quite a long time before reviewing. I'm careful not to push too hard while turning lever, and it has held up great. If it did break at this point, I'd order it again.
customer_reviews.author: addictedtoamazon

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this for purchase!
customer_reviews.text: While this item says "Westmark German Heavy Duty Rotary Grater", it's not made in Germany. It is made in China and says it is "Westmark Quality". If this is "Westmark Quality", I will never buy another Westmark product again. This is made of flimsy plastic with weak metal legs. You can feel the whole unit shift when pushing down vegetables on the depressor. I had a similar device many years ago that actually lasted several years and was very sturdy. I was thinking this would be the same. I don't anticipate this unit lasting more then a few uses. I would not recommend this for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donan Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and knuckles
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to shred frozen lemons to add to water and foods. I was tired of scraping my knuckles and freezing my hand on the regular shredder. Whole lemons won't fit in this (half will), but I wouldn't want to shred whole ones anyway. If they aren't at least quartered, the shreds are too long and are hard to swallow. I cut my frozen lemons down the center lengthwise, then down the center again, then across once or twice. Those chunks fit perfectly in this. I can do 3 lemons in about 5 minutes now, start to finish. Definitely a time-saver. I just rinse it clean and it's good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Ah Na

customer_reviews.title: So close to five stars
customer_reviews.text: I truly wanted to give 5 stars. My only complaint was it gave off small plastic shaving on the first few things we tried it on. After it made its groove we were good to go. I prefer to shred my own cheese and this works great. It also went thru potatoes no problem. My 3 year old loves to help! It is larger to store but I found it not to much bigger then a box grater when the feet are folded up. I toss it in the dishwasher and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: I love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for years. I picked it up at an estate sale. Unfortunately someone put my blades in the dishwasher and they proceeded to rust. So I was looking for another and finally came across this one. The parts on the new one are not of good quality so I will have to guard them carefully .. but this is definitely one of my favorite kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: This grater has a 1/8" gap between the grating wheel ...
customer_reviews.text: This grater has a 1/8" gap between the grating wheel and its housing. As long as your chocolate is thicker than 1/8" it grates well. When the chocolate gets thinner than the 1/8" gap it slips through. Then you have to pick out the big chunks by hand. It needs a telfon ring to close the gap yet allow the wheel to turn. If you don't care about the larger chunks, it might work okay for you.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: and the grater is lightweight and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: The price is right, and the grater is lightweight and easy to store. I would not call it heavy duty (as it is described), but with proper care it should last a while. Two drawbacks in my view: 1) it performed poorly grating ginger root (one of the reasons I bought the item); 2) the mouth for inserting vegetables is rather small and oddly shaped (given the grater's construction) and so you really have to cut down vegetables to slice them, and the output pieces are rather small. But then, the grater itself is not very big either. Pluses: easy to set up and clean; the blades are a snap to insert and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Ken W

customer_reviews.title: A great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these last year and use it at least 3 times a week. This year I got one for my daughter. You can't beat it for shredding cheese. (I won't buy pre shredded cheese because it has an anti-caking agent on it. Doesn't melt like real cheese in a recipe). Whereas a flat grater takes forever, with this you can literally grate a block of cheese in 10 seconds. Also great for making zuchinni noodles. Next I will be getting one for my niece and sister. A great kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Received incorrect accessories.
customer_reviews.text: The description says three blades... slicing, coarse grater and fine grater. It was shipped with two fine blades. Useless for me without the coarse blade. The body is plastic with metal legs and turning handle. I haven't tried to use it because of not having the correct blades but it appears to be flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Mouli-Julienne for probably 35 years and the end of the handle had broken off and it did not have suction cup feet, but it had the perfect disc to grate Parmesan cheese. The new Mouli is everything I could ask for with the exception of it NOT having the finer disc I've always used, so that is why it gets only 4 stars. However, my son was able to modify the old "fine" disc so that it fits the new handle and it is now the BEST and EASIEST grater to use EVER. I couldn't be happier with the overall product. Just wish they still made the fine disc.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick shredding
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for this style of tool for shredding cabbage, carrots for cole slaw. My mother had one and unfortunately it got lost :-( Since I couldn't have hers, I was happy to find one like it. It works great and the suction cups are a plus. I put a round pie pan underneath and rotate it as the veggies fall so there's not a big lump.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: I Love it! It shreds cheese just like I like ...
customer_reviews.text: I Love it! It shreds cheese just like I like it, and talk about hash browns? Oh the best way to go and no more grated knuckles and nails.. I like mine so well that I turned tight around and ordered two more for my married kids.. Way to go as I had quit buying the pre shredded dry tasteless cheese. I give that a "5" star!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: The easiest way to grate/shred!!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with this product's earlier model from the 60's, and our entire family used this grater. The only thing wrong with the earlier model was the aluminum grating discs that had to be hand washed to prevent rust. I am quite pleased to find that this updated version has stainless steel grating discs that will not rust. I am ordering additional sets for my grown children's households!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough positive words to describe how satisfied I am with this shredder. It works so easily and safely. Storage is not a problem because the legs fold over. The suction cups on the feet keep it in place while I grate & shred, and I have used both a plate and a bowl underneath it to collect the shredded cheese. No more scraped knuckles or fatigue shredding large amounts of hard cheese. Easier to clean than using my (electrical) Ninja.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost like the one mom had.
customer_reviews.text: My mother had one like this when I was a kid, and I was so excited to find one available online. I'm mostly happy with it. One concern is the plastic handle/paddle to hold the cheese in place. It seems like it might break at any moment. Also, it's got narrow grooves in the paddle surface, which I'm sure are meant to hold the cheese in place, but make for a little more work cleaning the cheese out from in between those little grooves. Otherwise, it's a pretty great tool! The handle/paddle on the one my mom had was metal. I wish this one was!
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Sisemore

customer_reviews.title: plastic not metal
customer_reviews.text: when i was a kid in germany i had one of these but there is a difference that i was a slight bit disappointed at and that is it's plastic. the one I had in germany was all metal. i just got it so haven't used it yet but the design is identical from the one i remember as a kid. i was actually surprised to see they still make them but again the blades are metal but the frame itself is plastic. still glad to have one as it was a great product them and works great on cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An exact replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had one of these for more than 40 years!! It wore out and was not sure that I would be able to find one to replace it with. Leave it to Amazon to have one and I snatched it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mtn Diva

customer_reviews.title: Good for fine grating
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good. I had a similar grater for years, but the handle broke. My problem with this grater is there is no larger grater disc. My old grater was perfect for making hash browns, but the disc had larger holes. I tried to put the old disc on this one but of course the handle would not fit. For fine grating is works OK.
customer_reviews.author: George from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Okay if you never experienced their old model!
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the model Westmark produced back in the 1950's that lasted all these years with regular use (little red knob on crank just fell off). Major downside to this model (besides being plastic and made in China) is that it doesn't provide a course shred wheel that used to make perfect-sized cabbage for coleslaw. It will get used but won't throw my 1950's one away!
customer_reviews.author: Donna V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouli
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years and years ago--and custody stayed with the ex ;-( So I was excited when I randomly Googled graters and this showed up. It is as good as the original metal one I had--maybe even better because it has suction feet. Works as well, too. Love it and would highly recommend it to anyone who want and easy peasy grater/slicer
customer_reviews.author: Judi Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a Mouli for YEARS to replace an old one I have. This one is AMAZING. The suctions at the end of the legs are a wonderful addition that secure the Mouli when in use. Love love love this product
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Growing up my mother had the metal version of this and it got lots of use over the years so I'm glad to see there is still a version of it available. This one is made of decently strong plastic but it doesn't have the same solid feel my mother's Mouli had. I shred potatoes for hashbrowns and so far it's working fine after about 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Would be better if it had a smaller shredder blade.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my mother swears by her old all metal Moulie grater. She has had hers for 45 years, and it isn't really something that they make anymore. I bought it so that I could make my own shredded potatoes, shred carrots for carrot cake, and to shred cabbage quickly for coleslaw. The only drawback that I have so far is that the smallest blade attachment is a little too big for my liking for coleslaw or carrots. I remedied this by going to an antique store and finding an old moulie blade (apparently you can find the blades easier that the actual mill). Other than needing a smaller blade, I really love this grater.

customer_reviews.title: Not made like they used to
customer_reviews.text: This rotary grater is made rather cheaply. I have my original one from the 80's and it is so much heavier and stronger. The only reason i got the new one is I lost one of my favorite blades and it started to rust. I will use the new one but I am disappointed. It's a German brand but made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bonni Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Tierd of dragging out the food processer for small batches ? This is for you.
customer_reviews.text: This rotary grinder is awesome ! I read several reports on hand held grinders and this was top rated. I replaced my barrel type grinder with this very well constructed unit. Wish I would have bought it first. It grinds everything from pickled dicon to cheese to nutmeg. Beats getting out the food processor for a small batch of anything. Enough room under the unit for a small plate and it stores very simply with the foldable legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a grater
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for the best, but this is a shredder,/slicer, not a grater. No blade for actual grating. It also leaves large chunks unshredded because of gap between blade and pusher. Unwieldy and takes up lots of room. Feels unsteady despite the rubber feet and cheaply made. An old-fashioned hand grater is far superior--easier to use, and easier cleanup. This is going to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Best of all
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder. It is easy to use and I like the idea that I can grind different veggies beside cheese. I am so glad I found you guys on Amazon. I will be sure to tell my friends about your great product
customer_reviews.author: B. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: Finally a replacement for a grater just like this that I have had for 30+ years. It was rusted but I didn't want to let go of it because it worked so well. I live alone and didn't want to have to drag out some huge electrical appliance to grate or slice a small amount. This is just perfect for small or large amounts. Thank you for bringing this back into production.
customer_reviews.author: Peace 4 You

customer_reviews.title: can grate carrots the European way = fine and delicious
customer_reviews.text: Tried and returned different graters...cannot get the French electric ones here without a heavy duty transformer... American grater make carrots thick and not as savory as the French thin grated ones... some lemon and oilve oil, little salt and voila...
customer_reviews.author: ALG

customer_reviews.title: small quantities you either waste half your food or need to pull out the knife to finish chopping it
customer_reviews.text: The handle doesnt grip the food well enough so it all ends up squished to one side, which puts the handle on an angle making it even harder to grip. There is also a 5mm gap between the blade and the frame/handle so the last bit of food slides between. I guess it would work ok for large quantities where you fill it right up but for small quantities you either waste half your food or need to pull out the knife to finish chopping it. We got this based on the great reviews but I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: the knob broke after 6 uses!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find a way to contact this German company, and the only way it seems I am able to is via an international call? I would like someone from their warranty dept. to contact me to replace the red plastic knob, as it is clearly defective. I used this thing 6 times to grate cheese (1/2 of a 1 lb block of cheese each time) and the metal turning handle broke through the red plastic knob. I will add a photo later. I followed the manufacturers cleaning instructions to the letter, hand washed and dried immediately after use.... here's hoping this works as I can't seem to contact them otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aweful waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The product is made out of cheap plastic and it goes all over the counter and it's so hard use it your arms are so so tired after using the product not worth the money. I wish I didn't have to give it any stores at all to write a review.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: Works effectively, but flimsy structure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product chiefly for grating hard cheese, like Parmesan or Romano. Yesterday was my first experience with it. Instructions for use were minimal, but I was able to figure out how to use it. It did the job--more or less--but the structure was so flimsy that I had to refrain from exerting full pressure for efficient grating, because I could sense that with full pressure the plastic of which the outer structure is made would break easily. But with caution and patience, I was able to shred the cheese satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: S. Limmson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the main purpose of shredding cabbage. Works very well! People need to realize that you have to slide a plate or other item under it to catch the shreds as they come out. An older school tool but is the best for making slaw. Suction is pretty good, just make sure it is sitting on a surface that allows the suction cups to adhere to.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Thurstin

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to a mandolin
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with one of these at home when I was little. Now that I’m a grown up, I’ve been looking forever for one of these. I have this fear of mandolins, off slicing my finger tips. This grater is a perfect solution to that. The lid keeps my fingers protected. It’s impossible to turn the handle if the lid is not closed. So glad that I was able to find it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: P.S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Not very well made, wouldn't ever buy again. A piece of crap
customer_reviews.author: Chubs

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy on your hands.
customer_reviews.text: Had searched for this product for awhile to replace one that finally wore out. This one has fewer discs, but it works great and is a welcome addition to our kitchen. It's also SO much easier on older hands.
customer_reviews.author: NightVisions

customer_reviews.title: Great grater!
customer_reviews.text: We buy parmigiano cheese by the 1/4 wheel, and I've gone through many types of graters over the years. I have a neuromuscular condition that makes it difficult to grip anything for more than a couple minutes at a time. It used to take 20 minutes, with multiple pauses for the pain, to shred 12 ounces. This rotary grater is so easy to use. In less than 2 minutes, I've shredded more than we can use for a couple of meals. Its great for using up all those small, hard to grate pieces. All without the risk of shredding your nails or knuckles!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L

customer_reviews.title: Its exactally what its supposed to be a hand powered food processor
customer_reviews.text: I sliced carrots yesterday and i make shredded potatoes for hash browns with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: The product is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Made in China to German Quality Standards. Huh?? Definitely not what I would call German Quality. However, it does do the job. Have the same issues as some have said, leaves that last 1/8" unshredded. It's not the robust tool I used as a kid, but for lack of finding an original, all metal grater, this is an okay substitute. Makes shredding potatoes so much easier than scraping up and down a flat scraper. The product is easy to assemble, easy to use, easy to clean. Probably should rate higher, but I'm comparing it to the original.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No German at all!
customer_reviews.text: The moment I opened the package, I was disappointed. This so called German quality product looks so flimsy, the packaging is so cheap. The suction cup doesn’t even work well. Not worth the price at all.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: very Nice Small Appliance
customer_reviews.text: Does a Block of Cheese in about 45 seconds... Very Very Functional... Cranks a little hard but the proof is in the seconds instead of minutes... Cleans Up in Seconds Also.. Love this little ingenuity.......
customer_reviews.author: David Winkle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I like this cheese grater because it’s easy to operate. Also, the construction with three legs makes it steady. I do wish there were other sizes for grading cheese. I also wish there was a way to prevent that last layer of cheese from sliding under the cheese enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little kitchen tool.. Makes potatos patties a breeze. And other tubers too.. 3 blades . easy to clean 3 minutes. And done . back on the shelf. . yes dish washer safe. But why.
customer_reviews.author: ALBERTO B.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: This grater is ok and served the purpose for which it was intended. I wish the pressure arm had a handle, it would make it easier to lift. The cleanup is kind of messy as stuff builds up under the unit because it sits so close to the surface. Also, because of this reason you can't really put a bowl or plate under it to catch what is grated. But since I probably won't use it for anything other than grating cheese, it's really good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Yanika

customer_reviews.title: Flimsier than my mother’s metal version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my mother had a metal one exactly like it growing up and I loved it. This is a plastic version as I can’t find a metal one anywhere and it’s not nearly as good as my mother’s. It’s still easy to clean up but the give of the plastic makes it’s use more difficult. Still better than any other cheese grater I’ve ever used on the market. The suction cups also fall off and have broken I wish I could find replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amy LaRee Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Inefficient and requires more force than necessary for grating.
customer_reviews.text: Looked like the ticket for quick-grating of les veggies so as not to have to roll out the Cuisinart for a small shred. Fatal flaw is flimsiness as the plastic compression arm yields under pressure so that excess force is necessary to compress whatever you stash in the hopper against the grater. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Colin W

customer_reviews.title: Only metal are the blades
customer_reviews.text: Will see how well it works and stands up to time use. Hoping it will last as long if not longer than the metal one mom has. Over 60 years. One of the grating blades broke and had to get replace from another kit we found
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilbury

customer_reviews.title: Nouli
customer_reviews.text: this replaced one we got about 15 years ago. for a grater that broke. The grater in this one is NOT the same size, so... we wasted our money!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works great, saves time prepping foods.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this slicer for my Aunt. I have one that's years old and we used it to slice apples for applebutter. She liked mine so much that I gave her one. it works great on anything I've tried to slice or grate. The slices are uniform and It's easy to change blades and cleans up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced this from the same one I was using that was my mothers which was about 50 years old or more It is still working and I didn't even think that they still made this product when I saw it I decided to replace it in case the other broke. I strictly use it to grate hard cheese for pasta like Parmesano, Grana Padana and Pecorino Romano. It is quick,easy to use and the small grind is perfect for the cheese as I like my cheese shredded and not ground like a powder
customer_reviews.author: ROBERTA SCIASCI

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, had one years ago that somehow was left behind during one of my moves. I was thrilled to see that it is still being made as it is One of my Favorite Kitchen tools ever. it is so easy to use, clean, and store....thinking about buying this? Buy it you will not regret your decision it will last a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GRATER!
customer_reviews.text: We received a similar product 30 years ago for Christmas. It still worked but the blades were rusty and it looked pretty unappetizing. My husband uses at least once a week for hashbrowns. Been looking for a replacement for years and had tried other styles and kept going back to old rusty one. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki M Noel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to shred carrots for Ghabeli ( carrot rice) and it works great. We used to have one of these that was all metal when I was a kid. Although I like the metal better this does the job just as fine. I shredded at least 10 pounds of carots and it worked perfectly. The only negative thing I can think of is that some pieces of carrots get stock in the small holes in the plastic. Price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse H

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: Product is made very cheaply I owned one of these made of all metal but it got lost in a move, that one was great. This one is made of plastic and metal when your are using it I feel like it could break any minute. If shredding things like carrots its hard to turn, anyway I expected it to be a lot sturdier. I guess it would be ok for softer foods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this grinder for over 20 years. It was previously made by Moulinex and now it was bought by Westmark. It makes a perfect holiday present and helps you in the kitchen!Your fingers are also safe when using this kitchen tool. I can't tell you how many time I got my fingers cut and scraped when used traditional grinders. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena Allanson

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well for like 6 months than several small pieces of plastic broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for like 6 months than several small pieces of plastic broke on the bottom that helps hold the grater in place and all the suction feet broke. They should make an all stainless version or cast iron than all buy another one, plastic is just cheap and doesn't last in the kitchen. I really like the design I might even try get a friend to make me one out of stainless steel or cast iron. I have bought a new cheese grater since mine broke but it is also mostly plastic because what I'm looking for has to be custom made, but I hope my new one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsy Romick

customer_reviews.title: I loved it then
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these 40+ years ago. I loved it then!! I don't own any grater except this one! It came with 5 blades & no suction feet at the time but I lost one... I looked & looked for the blade for years before I found this one & ordered it immediately. love it! love it! LOVE it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: P.D. Palmatier

customer_reviews.title: Great other than some extra cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about it, except the extra holes in then plastic underneath, cheese can get caught in there and be difficult to clean. Only reason I gave 4 stars. Otherwise great and grating cheese is super quick.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Manning

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for a food processor
customer_reviews.text: I needed to shred sweet potatoes for a recipe. It worked great! Slightly stained the white portions, but nothing I can’t live with.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Life

customer_reviews.title: always seems to do what its intended for ...
customer_reviews.text: had one before this one , but it all of a sudden disappeared (family member) got it..
customer_reviews.author: Ralph L. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far and it's great for making all kinds of salads quickly and with minimum effort. They have lots of these in Europe so I was glad to find this here for a fair price
customer_reviews.author: SunshineBerry

customer_reviews.title: Oldie but Goodie
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. They last forever and are quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is kind of a cool utensil. I'd never used anything like this and it did a great job making hash browns out of potatoes. Just wish it had a board under it to keep it stable but all in all it was very neat, easy to clean, it comes apart for cleaning and storage and doesn't take a lot of room in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: intel99

customer_reviews.title: This is simply the best cheese grater I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best cheese grater I've ever used. It's not dishwasher-safe, but it's very easy to wash and dry by hand. I haven't tried grating anything but cheese (works really well), and cooked chicken (did not work at all, FYI). I believe it would also do well with hard vegetables. Much easier than a box grater.
customer_reviews.author: avalynda

customer_reviews.title: slicer, grater
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Quick easy to use and cuts like a pro. You don't have to get the big food processor out - you can slice cheese, cabbage, carrots - waaa laaa done. Awesome little product.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rach

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small amounts.
customer_reviews.text: It is much smaller than the older one I used to have. It does the job as long as I only want a small plate of shredded cheese. It is difficult to use over a bowl and the cheese piles up fast on a plate so I’m constantly turning it. It is ideal for someone who only needs a small amount of what ever you are shredding.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J

customer_reviews.title: Great, but legs too short
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The downside is the very short legs. I had to move it all the time to clean under it so I could continue to use it. I really do like it though
customer_reviews.author: Alice M.

customer_reviews.title: Low tech rules.
customer_reviews.text: Leave it to AMZ to offer a handy gadget that I have sought for years!
customer_reviews.author: Meeker mouse

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I have this product in all metal. I bought this as a replacement, it is dissatisfying as the nuts barely are ground. It clogs and needs complete disassembly to continue.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: I had a hard time finding another one and so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these a long time ago and I used it a lot. I had a hard time finding another one and so glad I did. Very easy to use and does the quick jobs very well. Everyone would like this.
customer_reviews.author: earldean browning

customer_reviews.title: Great Grate
customer_reviews.text: Mom had one many years ago. This one is new and slightly improved but basically same principles. Works grate , pun intended.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: it is so good that it can stay in my kitchen only having ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy this. Even if you only need it for cheese, it is so good that it can stay in my kitchen only having one purpose, whereas everything else needs to earn its keep by being versatile. I haven't tested it on anything but cheese yet, but it is AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Rankin

customer_reviews.title: A terrific grater
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago at a kitchen show. However, the discs eventually rusted and became unappetizing to use. I looked on Amazon and found a new one. It is the best for grating vegetables and much safer than a box grater.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Even my 4 yr old granddaughter loves using this (with supervision)
customer_reviews.text: My mother got me one of these years ago. Somewhere along the way I lost it and have been trying to find a replacement. So glad Amazon has virtually everything. I got one for my daughter-in-law and she loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nifty
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I thought it would, easy to use and dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.author: mandi

customer_reviews.title: quality overall
customer_reviews.text: This is very well built and the blades are sharp and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Teacher

customer_reviews.title: We had an older version and loved it! I used this today to shred cheese
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version and loved it! I used this today to shred cheese, it worked beautifully. I don't know why I like using this method for my scalloped potatoes and shredding of cheese. The blades are sharp and the suction cups really make for a no skid surface. Clean the blade disc with a vegetable brush.
customer_reviews.author: Curlytop

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I make my own laundry soap and this works fantastic for grinding up soap.
customer_reviews.author: Queenofdaze

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is small but mighty. No need for hauling out your food processor. Easy to use and nice variety of blades. Going to purchase for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERIES OR ELECTRIC CORDS.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Mouli we've had. We wore the first one out. What a relief to get a replacement. It's especially good for cheeses and fresh garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Young

customer_reviews.title: Safe and effective
customer_reviews.text: Best cheese grater for making large amount of grated cheese for things like Mac and cheese. Fast and easy!
customer_reviews.author: DocRaffetto

customer_reviews.title: ... ago and it finally bit the dust - so happy we found this one on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: we had the original one from 30 years ago and it finally bit the dust - so happy we found this one on Amazon, been looking for about 5 years. Better than any other food processor!!!!!LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Marietta Snyder

customer_reviews.title: I was very concerned because the plastic felt pretty flimsy compared to our old one
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened this up, I was very concerned because the plastic felt pretty flimsy compared to our old one. But, I went ahead and used it and it worked very well. Not sure how long it will last given the lack of sturdiness of the plastic portions, but, in the meantime, it will be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on the date promised. Brought back memories of childhood when used it first time. Product worked very well only bad thing about it the plastic parts were all metal in the 70's or 80's..Lol but product worked just like I remembered
customer_reviews.author: Bill Snow

customer_reviews.title: Jams up with food
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hash potatoes with. It is nothing but a pain - it jams up with potato and is difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.author: David Si

customer_reviews.title: Would get 5 stars if the legs were longer.
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time but wish the legs were longer so a bowl would fit under it. I have to put wax paper on the counter top and shred things onto the paper, and slide the paper out and dump the shredded ingredients to a bowl. Kinda annoying but the machine is easy to use and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Grating cheese will actually be fun! This machine makes easy work of even the ...
customer_reviews.text: Grating cheese will actually be fun! This machine makes easy work of even the hardest cheeses. It mows right through parmesan no problem. The only thing that's a bummer about this gadget is that it's pretty bulky and takes a lot of room to store.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Marcus

customer_reviews.title: The new one has the best blades, stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Our old one broke after at least 20 years of service. It was our 2nd one, after an all metal one that had lasted 25 years. The new one has the best blades, stainless steel. The angle on the turning arm makes it easier to turn. I can't imagine grating cheese without a Mouli.
customer_reviews.author: Lucile P Meinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Super Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is even better quality than the one I had for 30 years. Gave that one away and couldn't find a new one to replace it till now. I am delighted with this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: mlenya

customer_reviews.title: If you like cheeses, this is a necessity in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: If you like cheeses, this is a necessity in your kitchen. They used to be available everywhere for $15 - $20. This one is better quality plastic but they forgot a finger grip to pull up the presser after the chunk is grated.
customer_reviews.author: in memoriam IckisAndShorty[.com]

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I received the rotary quickly and have used it today for the first time. It performed well and was very easy to use. I do wish it had a larger chute area for the foods to be sliced and was metal instead of plastic. Overall, I am satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: klara

customer_reviews.title: It was so easy and convenient for shredding
customer_reviews.text: We has something very similar to this growing up. It was so easy and convenient for shredding, slicing, anything. I'm happy with this one. I don't know because I got older and weaker, or if it's the shredder, but it doesn't seem to be as easy as the one I grew up with.
customer_reviews.author: Mugsy

customer_reviews.title: Time saver for carrots - could be more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It works well to grate my carrots, but it doesn't feel very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Kuoch

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same style my family used back in the 50's. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet M.

customer_reviews.title: Rotary Grater
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband as he wanted to be able to make hash brown potatoes in places that had no electricity. He loves it so much, he uses it all the time at home. It's easy to set up and the feet are suction cups that adhere to the countertop nicely. Simple to clean and just an all around handy tool. We haven't used it for anything but potatoes yet, but there are other disks for larger strips and slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Pantalones

customer_reviews.title: I like the way it is constructed
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it is constructed. however, to me, it's awkward to use on certain things. For instance you and take a stick of celery or acarrot and stand it up to shred it. Basically I think the only thing it's good for is to shred cheeese.
customer_reviews.author: Denny B

customer_reviews.title: Not thought out.
customer_reviews.text: The leg are not high enough to fit a decent size bowl under it.
customer_reviews.author: sc007

customer_reviews.title: I have bought so many cheese graters and finally found ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many cheese graters and finally found one that works for any kind of cheese. Bought it for bff birthday present and will be buying several for Christmas gifts. I would give it 10 stars if I was allowed.
customer_reviews.author: andrea ramsey

product_meta.title: Westmark Schnitzel Mouli Rotary Grater, One Size, Gray
product_meta.description:
Features:
- (3) High quality stainless steel blade disks
- (1) Coarse grate blade disk
- (1) Fine grate blade disk
- (1) Cutting and slicing blade disk
- Ergonomic ABS handle and base
- (3) Non-slip rubber suction feet

About the Brand:
HIGHEST QUALITY WITH TREND AND TRADITION! Westmark of Germany is well known for its quality craftsmanship of kitchen gadgets. Westmark has been making reliable kitchen products for over 50 years. As a specialized and reliable partner, Westmark offers a wide range of practical and uncomplicated kitchen products designed to make cooking and life in the kitchen easier. For traditional reasons, Westmark produces most of their products in Elspe, Germany. 

Money Back Guarantee: If you are not happy with our product, simply return the item to Amazon for a full refund, but we are confident that you will LOVE our product!
feature_bullets: GERMAN ENGINEERED HIGH QUALITY KITCHENWARE: Westmark’s Rotary Grater is among the best in the world and is rated to be one of the best kitchenware brands available today.

MATERIAL: Each product is made using high quality stainless steel blade disks with an ABS base and handle. Included are three rubber suction feet to ensure a tight and secure hold. the product can also be folded away to save a ton of space. See below for more details.

EASY AND READY TO USE: This easy to use product comes with three different disks for three different shapes to grate. There’s a drum for coarse grating, one for fine grating, and another one for slicing or cutting. Ideal for cheese, carrots, cucumbers, nuts, and much more! Equipped with an ergonomic handle, Westmark’s product is efficient and comfortable to use.
EASY TO CLEAN: Simply use soap and water to clean the product.
5 YEAR WARRANTY: Backed with a 5 year warranty, Westmark is completely confident that you will love their product or we will refund your money back, no questions asked!
